Daily report: [2019-01-29 Tue]

TODO Headline Time
Total time 3:17
Completed Tasks 3:17
DONE   Respond to MB 0:05
DONE   Respond to MD 0:04
DONE   Send email to DD about rescheduling 0:04
DONE   3.1 1:17
DONE   3.2 0:25
DONE   3.3 0:21
DONE   3.4 0:32
DONE   3.5 0:11
DONE   3.6 0:16
DONE   Zybook Chapter 3 - Sets 0:02

Summary

Today I dedicated time to schedule meetings for this week and the following week. I completed Zybook reading of Chapter 3 - Sets. I took notes of the material and noticed areas for improvement.

For my life hacking I tested waking up at 7am, logging of daily tasks and using pomodoro’s in emacs to remind me of when to take breaks.

Problem

I noticed I setup two 120min focus blocks, one for each one of my classes without any recovery period in between. This then leads to exhaustion and frustration. This is a marathon. I need to change my perspective and interpret graduate school more as a distance runner, as a swimming and pace myself accordingly and adapt.

During the Zybook I experienced some difficulty with Set operations that are complex and being able to determine in a Venn diagram the shaded region a complex set operation.

Insight

I will incorporate additional recovery blocks in between my sessions. Practicing thinking and moving slower to gain clarity of mind when learning a new concept / idea. The complex set operations, particular identifying regions can be done if each part of the set operation is broken down to it’s individual simple part and doing it step by step rather than trying to visualize it the entire process in one go.

I must protect my mind, similar to a garden and nurture it. To this end I have to change my schedule in Google Calendar so that it’s a reflection of my natural starting/stopping points. As of now when I have an agenda item/task that I don’t complete in a given time-frame/box I feel negative emotions about my performance. I can redefine what success look like for me. I can change and adapt to circumstances.

The midterm is approaching. I need to start reviewing and creating a strategy of how to best prepare each exam.

Tomorrow

  • To complete Homework assignment #3 for CS5002 and
  • To review sets for tomorrow’s lecture

Completed Tasks
